alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Marion (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 7:19PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Marion and Crawford Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 718 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Sycamore to Mount Victory. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Marion, Bucyrus, Galion, Crestline, Prospect, New Washington, La Rue, Morral, Waldo, Chatfield, Benton, Caledonia, New Bloomington, Green Camp, Tiro, North Robinson, Oceola, Sulpher Springs and State Route 229 at US Route 23. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Gusty winds will proceed the heavy rain with these storms. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
